result.execSummary:
The defendant August Lee Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. August Lee Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • August Lee Miller was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • August Lee Miller was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:31 AM Defendant August Lee Miller in court.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald in court for August Lee Miller.  Attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to counts 2 and 3. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2 and 3. Count 1 is dismissed on motion of the State. Court orders sentence withheld 12 months probation on each count. Defendant must report to probation today. Court imposes one set of costs on count 3. Costs waived on count 2. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 4 days.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
